result.execSummary:
The defendant Raydell Deshawn Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Marijuana. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 8/15/2016 or alternate 5 days jail. Payment plan fee of $15.00 to be added.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raydell Deshawn Miller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Raydell Deshawn Miller in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend Count 1 to a county ordinance violation of possession of THC.  Count 2 is dismissed and read-in.  Defendant pleas no contest.  Court imposed a fine of $267.50.  Defendant to pay $50/month beginning August 15, 2016 or alternate 5 days jail.

ADDRESS INFO for Raydell Deshawn Miller
Current: 1010 Pearl St, Waukesha, WI 53186 United States  (Effective: 07-11-2016)
Prior: 320 Walton Ave, Waukesha, WI 53186
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Raydell Deshawn Miller in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for her client to do some community service before the plea gets entered. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Raydell Deshawn Miller in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for her client to complete some more of his treatment. She is asking for a plea date. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Raydell Deshawn Miller in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment as the defendant has another initial appearance next week on new charges. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Raydell Deshawn Miller in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for her client to start treatment as there is a offer contingent of him doing the treatment. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Raydell Deshawn Miller in court with attorney Jorge Fragoso for  Kelsey Morin.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for 60 days. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Raydell Deshawn Miller in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
